title: 07. Augustus and Tradition
description: Augustus’ presentation of his rule as a restoration of Republican traditions while consolidating personal power.

questions.question: What claim did Augustus make regarding his relationship with the Roman Republic?
options: That he restored it in full
That he restored its practices while retaining control
That it was no longer relevant

questions.question: Why is Augustus’ claim to have restored the Republic debated by historians?
options: His powers represented a clear break from tradition

questions.question: How were Augustus’ powers presented to appear traditional?
What aspect of Augustus’ rule clearly broke with Republican tradition?
What did Augustus believe contributed to Rome’s earlier instability?
How did Augustus use coinage in relation to morality?
options: To promote himself as moral restorer

questions.question: Which poet describes Augustus as bringing a new Golden Age?
What aim lay behind Augustus’ moral reforms?
options: Protection of Roman blood and values

questions.question: Why are Augustus’ moral reforms significant despite being unpopular?
options: They reveal his desire to promote traditional values

questions.question: Which lapsed Republican practice did Augustus revive?
How did Augustus’ religious policies reflect tradition?
options: By restoring temples and priestly colleges

questions.question: Why does the Imperial Cult complicate Augustus’ claim to restore tradition?
options: It introduced worship of a living ruler

questions.question: What criticism does Tacitus make of Augustus’ religious honours?
options: That they left no honours for the gods

questions.question: What action demonstrates Augustus’ control over tradition itself?
What does Augustus’ editing of the Sibylline Books suggest?
